description: Comprehensive quiz about Union, State and Local Government using school analogies

questions.question: The President of India is like which person in a school?
questions.explanation: The President is like the principal of the whole country - the ceremonial head who oversees everything.

questions.question: How is the President of India chosen?
options: A) Direct voting by all citizens
B) Chosen by the Prime Minister
C) Electoral College voting by elected representatives
D) Appointed by the Supreme Court
questions.explanation: Like how class prefects might choose the head prefect, elected representatives choose the President through Electoral College.

questions.question: Parliament is like which group in a school?
questions.explanation: Parliament is like the student council - where representatives come together to make decisions for everyone.

questions.question: How many houses does the Indian Parliament have?
questions.explanation: Parliament has two houses: Lok Sabha (lower house) and Rajya Sabha (upper house), like having junior and senior student councils.

questions.question: Lok Sabha members are elected for how many years?
questions.explanation: Like how class representatives serve for one academic year, Lok Sabha members serve for 5 years.

questions.question: The Prime Minister is like which student in a school?
questions.explanation: The Prime Minister is like the head boy/girl - the student leader who leads the student council and represents all students.

questions.question: Who chooses the Prime Minister of India?
options: C) The party with majority in Lok Sabha
questions.explanation: Like how the student group with most class representatives gets to choose the head boy/girl, the party with majority in Lok Sabha chooses the Prime Minister.

questions.question: The Prime Minister's team of ministers is like what in a school?
questions.explanation: The Council of Ministers is like different subject monitors - each minister handles a specific area like education, health, etc.

questions.question: India has how many lists that divide powers between Union and State governments?
questions.explanation: India has three lists: Union List (like school-wide rules), State List (like class-specific rules), and Concurrent List (shared rules).

questions.question: Which list contains subjects that both Union and State governments can make laws about?
questions.explanation: The Concurrent List is like subjects where both principal and class teachers can make rules - like education and health.

questions.question: The Governor of a state is like which person in a school branch?
options: C) Head boy/girl of that branch
questions.explanation: The Governor is like the principal of a school branch - representing the main school (Union) in that branch (State).

questions.question: Who appoints the Governor of a state?
options: A) People of the state vote directly
C) The Chief Minister of the state
questions.explanation: Like how the main principal appoints branch principals, the President appoints Governors.

questions.question: The Chief Minister of a state is like which person in a school branch?
options: B) Head boy/girl of that branch
questions.explanation: The Chief Minister is like the head boy/girl of a school branch - the student leader chosen by that branch's student representatives.

questions.question: How is the Chief Minister chosen?
options: A) Direct voting by state citizens
C) Leader of majority party in State Legislature
questions.explanation: Like how the student group with most representatives in a branch chooses their head boy/girl, the majority party in State Legislature chooses the Chief Minister.

questions.question: State Legislature is like what in a school branch?
options: A) All students in the branch
questions.explanation: State Legislature is like the student council of a school branch - representatives from different classes in that branch.

questions.question: Panchayats are like what kind of group in a school?
questions.explanation: Panchayats are like small class committees in village areas - local groups that solve local problems and make local decisions.

questions.question: What is the smallest unit of Panchayat system?
questions.explanation: Gram Panchayat is like the smallest class committee - handling the most local issues in villages.

questions.question: How many levels are there in the Panchayat system?
questions.explanation: There are three levels: Gram Panchayat (class level), Block Panchayat (section level), and Zilla Panchayat (school level).

questions.question: Municipalities are like what in a school?
questions.explanation: Municipalities are like class committees in city areas - they handle local problems in urban areas like towns and cities.

questions.question: What type of areas do Municipal Corporations handle?
questions.explanation: Municipal Corporations are like committees for the biggest classes - they handle large cities with lots of people.

questions.question: Elections in India are like what activity in school?
questions.explanation: Elections are like choosing class representatives - students vote to select who will represent them in student council.

questions.question: What is the minimum age to vote in Indian elections?
questions.explanation: Like how only senior students can vote for head boy/girl, only citizens 18 years and above can vote in elections.

questions.question: Who conducts elections in India?
questions.explanation: Election Commission is like the teachers who supervise class representative elections - they ensure fair voting.

questions.question: When Union and State governments work together, it's like what in a school?
options: B) Principal and class teachers cooperating
questions.explanation: Like how principal and class teachers work together for students' benefit, Union and State governments cooperate for citizens' welfare.

questions.question: When there's a disaster, which governments work together?
options: C) Union, State, and Local governments together
questions.explanation: Like how principal, class teachers, and student monitors all help during school emergencies, all government levels work together during disasters.

questions.question: What is the upper house of Parliament called?
questions.explanation: Rajya Sabha is the upper house, like a senior student council, while Lok Sabha is the lower house, like a junior student council.

questions.question: Defence and foreign affairs are included in which list?
questions.explanation: Like how school's overall security is handled by the main principal's office, defence and foreign affairs are Union government's responsibility.

questions.question: Police and public order are mainly in which list?
questions.explanation: Like how each class has its own discipline monitors, each state handles its own police and public order.

questions.question: The 73rd Amendment is related to which type of local government?
questions.explanation: The 73rd Amendment strengthened Panchayats, like giving more powers to rural area class committees.

questions.question: The 74th Amendment is related to which type of local government?
questions.explanation: The 74th Amendment strengthened Municipalities, like giving more powers to urban area class committees.

questions.question: How often are Lok Sabha elections held?
questions.explanation: Like how class representatives are chosen every academic year, Lok Sabha elections happen every 5 years.

questions.question: For how many years does the President serve?
questions.explanation: Like how a school principal serves for a fixed period, the President serves for 5 years.

questions.question: Education appears in which list, allowing both Union and State governments to make policies?
questions.explanation: Education is in Concurrent List, like how both principal and class teachers can make rules about studies.

questions.question: For how many years does a Governor normally serve?
questions.explanation: Like how a branch principal serves for a set period, a Governor normally serves for 5 years.

questions.question: Who is the head of a Gram Panchayat?
questions.explanation: Sarpanch is like the class monitor of a village - the elected leader of the Gram Panchayat.

instructions: This quiz helps children understand India's government structure using familiar school analogies. Each question relates government roles to school positions that children can easily understand.
